result.execSummary:
The defendant Bee Her was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact [Modifiers: Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: probation deft is currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling/combination of the two for at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.

Absolutely NO CONTACT with L.L. or immediate family. 

Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by Department.  Comply with sex offender registration requirements.  

DNA sample.  

Defendant must comply with sex offender registry law for 15 years.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: probation deft is currently serving

records.addlTxt: (EDE to DOC)

Sentencing Hearing held on Nov. 28, 2016 before Honorable LaMont K. Jacobson 
Includes 15CF638 and 15CF168.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 9:07 am 
INCLUDES 15CF638 AND 15CF168. 
State appears by DDA Theresa Wetzsteon; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.  
Interpreter sworn. 
State files amended information in 15CF638. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF168: Ct. 1 (Human Trafficking/Repeater)>>DISMISS. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>DISMISS. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>DISMISS. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF638: Ct. 1 (Child Enticement/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 14 years imprisonment - 6 years IC and 8 years ES - CONDITIONS OF ES: absolutely no contact with L.L. or immediate family; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 for at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; comply with sex offender registration requirements; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT notes def must comply with Sex Offender Registry law for 15 years. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 501 days sentence credit. 
COURT finds the def NOT eligible for CIP or SAP. 
COURT ORDERS sentence to run concurrent to probation def is currently serving and ORDERS sentence to begin immediately. 
COURT remands def into custody for transport to WSPS. 
Adj: 9:39 am 

cc: Br. 1 re: disposition in 15CF168.

Clerk Marisa.

COURT advises jury will be called off and counsel may call of their witnesses. 
COURT sets matter for plea/sentencing hearing on 11/28/2016 at 9:00 am in Br. 3 at which an interpreter will be present in the courtroom.

Case Called: 8:38 am 
State appears by DDA Theresa Wetzsteon and ADA Ralph Uttke; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.

State notes mother and father of victim need interpreter - 1 interpreter would be needed for both for their testimony. 
Atty Bohn notes 2 interpreters needed for her client - Atty Bohn notes 2 provision interpreters are scheduled for trial and makes request re: interpreter. 
Parties state need for 3 interpreters. 
COURT directs COC office to provide 3 interpreters for all week. 
State requests names of interpreters. 
COURT directs names of interpreters to be provided to counsel. 
State notes concerns re: witness availability. 
Atty Bohn notes subpoena was served on one witness who states they will be on vacation during trial. 
COURT notes it will not speculate re: witness honoring subpoena.

DEFT'S MOTION TO RECONSIDER IN LIMINE RULING ON SEQUESTRATION.

DEFT'S IN CAMERA INSPECTION MOTION. 
Argument.

COURT gives ruling - orders in camera inspection. 
State makes statement. 
COURT notes concerns re: trial date and time to obtain records. 
Atty Bohn makes statement. 
State requests clarification on ruling. 
COURT gives further ruling. 

DEFT'S OTHER ACTS MOTION. 
COURT delays ruling on this motion and directs parties to submit briefs as stated on the record. 

COURT removes jury trial date set for the week of 8/15/16 from the calendar. 
COURT finds deft freely, voluntarily, and intelligently withdrew speedy demand. 
COURT directs parties to see JA to set review hearing re: counseling records on 8/19/2016 for an hour and directs new trial date be set.
